p: Gamboa-Gómez et al. [ 114] showed in vitro and in vivo antihyperglycemic and antioxidant effects of oak leaves infusions and fermented beverages from Quercus convallata and Q. arizonica using female C57BL/6 mice. Their results indicated that oak leaves infusions and fermented beverages exhibited exerted inhibition of α-amylase (8–15% and 5–9%, respectively) and α-glucosidase (98% and 99%, respectively).
